6db74ed5-c647-4222-b0b0-d47910abe6c6: A character that selects this talent gains a bonus combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. You can take this talent multiple times, each time selecting a different feat.
d2df43df-0312-413a-b40a-b6da13d955e4: A character who selects this talent gains Blinding Critical as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if she doesn't meet the prerequisites.
7d8c1cc4-02fc-4826-80fd-0fb572fc6694: A character with this ability can sneak attack opponents with such precision that the blows weaken and hamper them. An opponent {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by one of her sneak attacks also takes 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}.
63b6b136-741b-4f23-8d30-46eb4245d3f5: A character with this talent has a cast-iron stomach or has trained themselves to withstand poisons, especially ingested ones. They gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} against poisons as well as a +4 bonus on saves against all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects that cause the character to be {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g} or {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}.
b97c01c0-a74d-40a5-847d-37bc2ff933de:
A dark lurker gains one rogue talent at 4th level and an additional rogue talent at 6th, 10th, 12th, 16th, and 18th levels. A dark lurker cannot select an individual talent more than once, unless its description says otherwise.
A dark lurker can take evasion as a rogue talent.
ef390161-350f-4963-8b89-e8412f9cf681: A knife master focuses her ability to deal sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with daggers and similar weapons to such a degree that she can deal more sneak attack damage with those weapons at the expense of sneak attacks with other weapons. When she makes a sneak attack with a dagger, kukri, punching dagger, starknife, or sai, she uses d8s to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} sneak attack damage instead of d6s. For sneak attacks with all other weapons, she uses d4s instead of d6s.
2f727b71-6ba1-4498-ac22-a18fe34b0209: A rogue adds 1/2 her level on {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g}.
85909d69-5e09-4edb-8640-74b915fa079d: A rogue who selects this talent gains Dirty Trick as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.
4b64e03b-95cf-4ed8-8ecc-0e0d4f99c803: A rogue with this talent adds {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
f88cd3e3-b9c6-4573-bd66-a1b02bb505c8: A rogue with this talent adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
3e85cece-37b0-4f41-8163-e0836d9a5864: A rogue with this talent can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery check{/g} in place of a {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} when attempting to disarm an opponent.
f879d4d2-2db7-4156-93ea-a5da0ab0b7dc: A rogue with this talent does not provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} when standing up from {g|ConditionProne}prone{/g}.
983db6a8-e9ec-4016-ba10-7de99d77c8ab: A rogue with this talent gains a familiar as the familiar option of the wizard's arcane bond class feature.
5fa5fb4e-fe42-4e60-b079-97dbb9d2bda1: A rogue with this talent gains a favored terrain, as the ranger class feature of the same name, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} does not increase with her level.
bfd31433-b960-4e42-9429-2e59fe02eb22: A rogue with this talent gains immunity to difficult terrain.
a2b0adb5-01b0-4aa5-9cb7-ecb6b2ab61dd: A rogue with this talent gains {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting conditions equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier.
fee62663-503d-45f6-9203-82c8784b5db3:
A sylvan trickster can select a witch hex in place of a rogue talent. At 10th level, the sylvan trickster can select a hex or major hex in place of a rogue talent. At 18th level, a sylvan trickster can select a hex, major hex, or grand hex in place of a rogue talent. She cannot select any hex more than once.
This alters rogue talents.
5d8e7181-8597-4d11-8d9c-846a8065c4a9: After 10th level, a character can choose one of the advanced rogue talents in place of a rogue talent.
6bfc3a77-671a-4298-a9f8-f58b7ff88bf0: An opponent that is dealt sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} by a character with this ability is affected by a {g|SpellsDispelMagicTarget}targeted dispel magic{/g} affecting one of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effects active on the target. The {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for this ability is equal to the character's level.
56b43c60-f320-435f-a030-7f6c55a432e0: As a rogue advances, they can choose unique {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} in addition to the regular {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, empowering them in combat and making them more useful outside it.
bb6dc70a-6e8b-45e0-a9e1-c892c32c5c68: As a rogue gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, she learns a number of talents that aid her and confound her foes. Starting at 2nd level, a rogue gains one rogue talent. She gains an additional rogue talent for every 2 levels of rogue attained after 2nd level. A rogue cannot select an individual talent more than once, unless its description says otherwise.
9a5399f4-fee7-47fd-8e81-06e62ff0d982:
At 10th level, an underground chemist can select one of the following alchemist discoveries in place of a rogue talent: enhance potion, extend potion, mummification, nauseating flesh, preserve organs or spontaneous {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}. She uses her rogue level as her alchemist level for determining the effects of her discoveries and whether she is able to select one.
This ability alters advanced talents.
688575a4-255e-4091-bd14-ba1da1a6a9f1: At 14th level, a dark lurker gains Greater Blind Fight as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} without having to meet the prerequisites.
c92200ae-aef7-4fbf-a604-22e6137a2a5f: At 1st level, a rogue gains Weapon Finesse as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. In addition, starting at 3rd level, she can select any one type of weapon that can be used with Weapon Finesse (such as rapiers or daggers). Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. Whenever she makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with the selected weapon, she adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}. If any effect would prevent the rogue from adding her Strength modifier to the damage roll, she does not add her Dexterity modifier. The rogue can select a second weapon at 11th level and a third at 19th level.
16015da2-ac8f-43c1-ad87-47ca60322dec: At 20th level, a dark lurker gains blindsight with a range of 30 feet.
7125e873-d031-4e7f-9fd5-a2173d7918ec: At 2nd level, a dark lurker gains Blind Fight as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} without having to meet the prerequisites.
f00bed07-19cb-4209-9404-cafa74581c0b:
At 2nd level, a dark lurker gains the ability to travel between shadows and deliver sudden strikes to victims. While within 5 feet of a larger creature, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the dark lurker can step into the creature's shadow and emerge from the shadow of an enemy larger than the dark lurker within 30 feet, then make a single sneak attack with a melee weapon against that enemy. At nighttime, the dark lurker gains a +2 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}.
At 14th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, the dark lurker can make a full attack with a melee weapon in a similar way. The first attack in this {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} is considered a sneak attack and gains a +2 circumstance bonus if made at nighttime.
Additionally, at nighttime, the dark lurker gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
0020e927-90df-46e4-b822-309502f74477: At 2nd level, an underground chemist is able to retrieve an alchemical item as if drawing a weapon. She adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt with splash weapons, including any splash damage. She also gains the Throw Anything {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat.
5ef74c4e-6e09-4340-9a68-c087a2a5aa8e: At 3rd level and every 6 levels thereafter, a master of all gains the Skill Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
17e77d8a-66d6-4dac-b9dc-7d34988ab0ff: At 3rd level, a knife master is so skilled in combat involving light blades that she gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against her with light blades. This bonus increases by +1 for every three levels, to a maximum of +6 at 18th level.
ecff1cae-7f69-446c-baca-64193dcf200c: At 3rd level, a rogue gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saves{/g} to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by traps. These bonuses increase by 1 every 3 rogue levels thereafter (to a maximum of +6 at 18th level).
68bab5b3-b49d-4c80-ad5f-12c46022fd6b: At 3rd level, whenever a thug deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, she can choose to forgo {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of sneak attack damage to make the target {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 her rogue level. This ability does not stack with itself — only the most recent duration applies.
e53fed30-1d11-42ec-b5f7-9d471e48fbff:
At 4th level, an underground chemist can deal sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with splash weapons.
This ability replaces the rogue talent gained at 4th level.
2e2f112c-f038-4cf9-aa9a-51df16824154:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all attacks made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
1098aaa3-f56f-46c1-819c-a1d549358c73:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Disoriented: The target takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
79f919e1-fc31-4009-b9e1-5c7b1824b8d8:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}).
Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
4537655d-7ec2-47c5-9d6c-03580a258b9b:
At 4th level, whenever a rogue deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a foe, she can also debilitate the target of her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, causing it to take a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (this is in addition to any penalty caused by a rogue talent or other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g}). The rogue can choose to apply any one of the following penalties when the damage is dealt.
Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all attacks made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
Disoriented: The target takes a –2 penalty on attack rolls. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
These penalties do not stack with themselves, but additional attacks that deal sneak attack damage extend the duration by 1 round. A creature cannot suffer from more than one penalty from this ability at a time. If a new penalty is applied, the old penalty immediately ends. Any form of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} applied to a target suffering from one of these penalties also removes the penalty.
f52318b3-8cb3-4179-a367-34af0b2eb819: At 8th level, a dark lurker gains Improved Blind Fight as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} without having to meet the prerequisites.
b63f725a-92cb-4dc3-94c4-340cd8a32125: At 8th level, a sylvan trickster gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 2/cold iron. At 11th level and every 3 levels thereafter, this damage reduction increases by 2 (to a maximum of DR 10/cold iron at 20th level).
7491f4ae-68fa-4cdf-b13e-39b8d40f1954: Bewildered: The target becomes bewildered, taking a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The target takes an additional –2 penalty to AC against all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty to AC against attacks made by the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
88dceb40-5bde-474a-a1a0-6d58c9c9eea5: Dark lurkers, also known as "the hungry night," use darkness as their ally.
fdf2bb63-b47b-4271-b6cb-e8d8fac980cd: Disoriented: The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. In addition, the target takes an additional –2 penalty on all attack rolls it makes against the rogue. At 10th level and 16th level, the penalty on attack rolls made against the rogue increases by –2 (to a total maximum of –8).
f7ea7892-32a1-4bdc-8607-6b906bff476f: Eldritch scoundrels can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}cantrips{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
6df737dc-c0da-4fea-8e6d-c8b17f2c7113: Hampered: All of the target's speeds are reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet).
33c54797-3241-4c7d-aea8-11a35d0ec64c:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to reach such a spot.
41c57354-8e51-472c-8f20-08c09778fe50: In the shadow of a larger creature
c825ae6f-ecbe-4ce7-9990-5e3ca58157ff: Most characters gain advantages when they {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flank{/g} an enemy, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} an enemy who can't see them or enjoy a similar fortunate position. But only rogues and slayers deal a tremendous amount of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in such a situation.
cfc0499c-a414-4673-9829-77ce361dd41d: Once per day, a rogue with this talent can designate a single enemy she is adjacent to as her prey. Until the end of her next turn, she can add her sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made against her prey, even if she is not {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanking{/g} it or it is not {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}.
02ec4693-06b1-422c-b3d7-ee95db0add74: Opponents {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by the character's sneak attack can't make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
1ac6414c-c69c-4b9a-a924-38afb0ddb88f: Rogue's main role in the party is dealing a horrendous amount of damage to enemies in melee combat. They don't have much health, but can be hard to hit thanks to their high Agility. Rogue also possesses a number of useful skills, from lying to picking locks and defusing traps.
b336fb7b-21d0-49b1-abcc-c12ff8de12bf: Rogues are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, sap, shortsword, and shortbow. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
f18a037e-1b76-4287-bc6c-3054b4f28990:
Rogues are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the hand crossbow, rapier, shortsword, and shortbow.
An eldritch scoundrel is not proficient with any armor or shields. Armor sometimes interferes with an eldritch scoundrel's gestures, which can cause her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with somatic components to fail.
bd908172-bfe9-45a2-8156-38e698096a95: Rogues excel at moving about unseen and catching foes unaware, and tend to avoid head-to-head combat. Their varied skills and abilities allow them to be highly versatile, with great variations in expertise existing between different rogues. Most, however, excel in overcoming hindrances of all types, from unlocking doors and disarming traps to outwitting magical hazards and conning dull-witted opponents.
6201ea99-656e-45ff-acac-3b7db2abe6cb: Rowdy adds {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per sneak attack dice to the damage of his vital strike. This is precision damage.
aba34247-1908-43f6-9194-0000d56a39e8: Some criminals steal with finesse, their victims only discovering the crime when the rogue is long gone and the coin already spent. A thug, on the other hand, cares nothing for finesse. Through both threat and violence, the thug gets what she wants by the promise of force, and has no problem making good on that promise as needed.
a53255bf-2f87-43fb-b7e4-41a36daac40a: Some half-elves spend all their time gaining new knowledge and skills, becoming masters of all.
b6e715db-bc7e-4130-9b70-132558f44ed3: Sometimes brute force is as effective as trickery and stealth, and sometimes even more. Rowdies prefer this approach, and are true masters of inflicting lots of pain in a straightforward manner.
bd775ceb-99ce-405e-b8dd-dcae08f29d1c: Students of arcane magic, legerdemain, and stealth, eldritch scoundrels are a rare breed of adventurer most commonly found seeking lost and valuable arcane writings in the ruins of fallen empires.
fe34d832-9f7b-4bc0-87f2-3efdb0f41c22: Sylvan tricksters are rogues who model themselves after the mischievous fey of legend. Though not spellcasters, sylvan tricksters learn minor magical abilities reminiscent of those favored by fey creatures. The journey for many sylvan tricksters began in childhood, learning at an elder's knee the stories of the fey and the secrets of how to resist their tricks. Sylvan tricksters often live in areas where the boundary with the Fey World is thin, and a few have even been there — voluntarily or not.
c9552d7b-a9c9-410c-9300-763071ca88ac: The character can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against an opponent who has just been struck for {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} in melee by another character. This {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} counts as an attack of opportunity for that {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and can't be used more than once per round.
19d9d2ad-bf2d-40c4-ba77-34accc34ab23:
The character can no longer be {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanked{/g}.
This defense denies another rogue the ability to sneak attack the character by flanking her, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target does.
375e282f-e4fe-433f-be59-ae5983c0e65e:
The character can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so. She cannot be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g}, nor does she lose her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} if the attacker is invisible. She still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized. A character with this ability can still lose her Dexterity bonus to AC if an opponent successfully uses the feint action against her.
If a character already has uncanny dodge from a different class, she automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead.
1ceb3667-560f-4683-8832-f69e68fe06b4: The knife master is a trained killer who specializes in close-up combat and the wave and weave of knife fighting. In her hands, daggers and other similar light blades become truly deadly instruments.
c2933bcc-d9bc-435f-a5b2-f9e4f850c957: The rogue becomes so confident in the use of certain {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} that she can use them reliably even under adverse conditions. When making a {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, she may take 10 even if stress and distractions would normally prevent her from doing so. A rogue can choose not to take 10 and can instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} normally.
8b49e90f-5c32-4c62-9e3c-f08e840edf6b: The rogue becomes so confident in the use of certain {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} that she can use them reliably even under adverse conditions. When making a {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion) skill check{/g}, she may take 10 even if stress and distractions would normally prevent her from doing so. A rogue can choose not to take 10 and can instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} normally.
ddeb49ce-7d7c-4951-9e65-c488d73d203b: The rogue becomes so confident in the use of certain {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} that she can use them reliably even under adverse conditions. When making a {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery skill check{/g}, she may take 10 even if stress and distractions would normally prevent her from doing so. A rogue can choose not to take 10 and can instead {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} normally.
a443196c-8e1e-48ba-aecc-473dc006463b: The rogue gains Trip as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.
1df46371-2d94-4e2d-ad1a-84c3c0843733: This ability allows a character to move at full {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} using the {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} without {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g}.
4a7da5ca-7012-41af-a0bf-edf599c3e994: This works like evasion, except while the character still takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} against an attack, they also take only half damage on a failed save. A {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} character does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
25969394-3fd8-4e7b-9ade-93280bd88d83: Underground chemists are part of the rotting, fetid underbelly of the alchemical world. While underground chemists can't hold a candle to dedicated alchemists, they're tricky and dangerous with alchemical substances and potions.
d95f59dc-1460-418b-8837-edc59327e88c: Upon reaching 20th level, a rogue becomes incredibly deadly when dealing sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Each time the rogue deals sneak attack damage, she can slay the target. The target receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} to negate the death effect. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the rogue's level + the rogue's {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier. Once a creature has been the target of a master strike, regardless of whether or not the save is made, that creature is immune to that rogue's master strike for 24 hours.
d972f906-c035-4703-b265-b7c392c0e4f9: When a character with this talent hits a creature with a melee weapon that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the target cannot make {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.
ad715176-940b-43d5-a807-dc61f70d71d1: When a character with this talent makes a {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception check{/g}, they gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.
96e81e97-c90f-4f91-996f-84f45060e40f: When making a sneak attack against a creature that has {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}, the character's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} reduces that damage reduction for two {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} by an amount equal to the character's level. This {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to damage reduction does not stack.
60fe9a27-5821-45be-bb5b-6a663afb3e1d: When the character is {g|ConditionConfusion}confused{/g} and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer confused.
8c26333e-c737-426e-aab6-1111e4652c40: When the character is {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer shaken.
c5bd5b77-1b79-4f79-98e6-2389975235c8: When the character is {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g} and hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} that deals sneak attack {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, the character is no longer sickened.
9308448e-d341-4885-89c8-65327bbd0d5b: Whenever a rogue lands a sneak attack, they can also inflict a special wound that would impose a negative effect on the enemy. There are many kinds of negative effects available, and the rogue can choose which of them to inflict.
bebaf7bc-0eba-44e5-9055-822e90f6f933:
Whenever a thug successfully uses {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} to demoralize a creature, the duration of the {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} condition is increased by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
In addition, if the target is shaken for 4 or more rounds, the thug makes the target {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} for 1 round.
5e019b81-547e-4d36-a717-7148814cbc1e: Whenever the character inflicts a {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} against a target using the debilitating injury class feature, they can select two penalties to inflict. The target can never be subject to more than two penalties in this way at one time. If any additional penalties are inflicted, any previous penalties immediately end. Any effect that {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to the target negates both of the penalties.
bb325e15-479f-419f-bb1b-1490e29e09f7: Whenever the rogue makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with a bite {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}, she adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}. If any effect would prevent the rogue from adding her Strength modifier to the damage roll, she does not add her Dexterity modifier.
